name: Lord Nil: 7 Deadly Sins
description: Experience a thrilling stage magic show from the famed entertainer Lord Nil. His new spectacle, "7 Deadly Sins," promises an evening of suspense and dazzling illusions.

name: Drunk Romeo & Juliet
description: Enjoy a hilarious and unpredictable take on a Shakespearean classic. In this performance, a professional cast performs 'Romeo & Juliet,' but one actor is chosen at random to drink several shots of whiskey before the show begins.

name: The Book of Mormon on Broadway
description: Catch the nine-time Tony Award-winning musical comedy from the creators of 'South Park'. This hilarious smash hit follows a mismatched pair of missionaries sent to a remote village in Uganda.

name: & Juliet on Broadway
description: This hilarious new musical flips the script on the greatest love story ever told, asking: what would happen next if Juliet didn’t end it all over Romeo? The show features a playlist of pop anthems as you've never heard them before.

name: Six: The Musical on Broadway
description: The six wives of Henry VIII take the mic to reclaim their identities in this high-energy pop concert musical. Witness five hundred years of historical heartbreak remixed into a celebration of 21st-century girl power.

name: Gypsy on Broadway
description: This classic musical fable follows the story of the ultimate ambitious stage mother, Momma Rose, who pushes her daughters into show business. The legendary show features a celebrated score by Jule Styne and Stephen Sondheim.

name: The Play That Goes Wrong
description: This classic murder mystery is chock-full of mishaps and madcap mania. Welcome to the opening night of 'The Murder at Haversham Manor,' where things are quickly going from bad to utterly disastrous.

name: Drama and Discourse in New York Theatre
description: Explore the heart of the American stage on a unique walking tour through New York's famed theater district. Discover the history and impact of Broadway and its iconic venues.

name: Open Hours at the Old Stone House
description: Come visit the Old Stone House, a historic Dutch farmhouse and the site of the 1776 Battle of Brooklyn. Explore the reconstructed house and learn about its pivotal role in American history.

name: Xanadu After School Skate
description: Get your roll on at this afternoon roller skating session for all ages. It's the perfect way to glide into the weekend with music and fun.

name: Abe Partridge & Jack Barksdale
description: Enjoy an evening of intimate live music featuring the unique sounds of Abe Partridge and Jack Barksdale. This show at a legendary Greenwich Village spot promises a memorable night of songs and stories.

name: Lyfe Jennings - The Adventures of Lyfe
description: Platinum-selling R&B singer-songwriter Lyfe Jennings performs live at an intimate seated venue. Don't miss this chance to hear his powerful and emotional ballads in person.

name: camoufly, dj something
description: Spend an evening on the rooftop with the electronic sounds of camoufly and dj something. Enjoy the city views and a great soundtrack to start your weekend.

name: Maiya Blaney, Semiratruth, Ideas for Conversations x Christopher Emond
description: Discover a diverse lineup of live performers in an intimate setting. This showcase features the unique talents of Maiya Blaney, Semiratruth, and a collaboration between Ideas for Conversations and Christopher Emond.

name: 12th Annual Uptown Bounce
description: Join two top museums, El Museo del Barrio and the Museum of the City of New York, for their annual summer block party. This vibrant event features DJs, dancing in the streets, and free admission to both museums.

name: Sunset Salsa
description: Dance into golden hour at Hudson River Park’s popular sunset salsa series. Each night kicks off with a beginner salsa lesson from a professional instructor, followed by an open dance party with a live DJ.

name: Toto + Men At Work + Christopher Cross
description: Get ready for a night of classic rock hits with a triple bill of legendary bands. See Toto, Men At Work, and Christopher Cross live on stage for an unforgettable summer concert.

name: Acid Bath
description: Experience a rare performance from the influential sludge metal band Acid Bath. The iconic group brings their heavy and distinctive sound to Brooklyn's newest premier venue.

name: Drive-By Truckers & Deer Tick
description: Don't miss a double bill of acclaimed alt-country and rock bands against the stunning backdrop of the NYC skyline. Drive-By Truckers and Deer Tick will share the stage for a night of powerful songwriting and energetic performances.

name: Girl In A Coma
description: The beloved indie rock trio from San Antonio performs for one night in Queens. Catch their piercing songs and energetic stage presence in an intimate club setting.

name: Safe Mind
description: Experience the electronic soundscapes of Safe Mind in a live concert setting. The artist will perform tracks from their latest album in a popular Brooklyn venue.

name: Eliana Glass + Melody English + Amiture Music
description: A night of live music featuring three distinct artists in a space dedicated to careful listening. Enjoy the varied sounds of Eliana Glass, Melody English, and Amiture Music.

name: River + Blues Concert Series: Afro Latin Jazz Orchestra
address: River Terrace & Warren St, New York, NY 10280
description: Enjoy sunset sounds at this free concert series bringing global and American roots artists to the waterfront. This edition features the incredible Afro Latin Jazz Orchestra, led by Arturo O'Farrill.

name: Top Shelf Stories
description: An evening of carefully crafted storytelling from some of the best performers in the city. This show features true tales from Pavar Snipe, Natasha Vaynblat, Sharon Spell, and Nat Townsen.

name: F*bomb Presents: Hole Tribute
description: The F*bomb rock and roll party presents a raucous tribute to the iconic grunge band Hole. Experience the raw energy and unforgettable songs of the 90s alternative legends.

name: GLORIOUS: Parade GLO Remix Release Party
description: Celebrate the new remix from the artist GLORIOUS at this Lower East Side party. Be the first to hear the track live and enjoy a full night of music and dancing.

name: Barbez w/ opener The Lonesome Organist
description: Catch a performance by the eclectic Brooklyn-based band Barbez, known for their unique blend of punk, classical, and international sounds. The evening opens with a set from The Lonesome Organist.

name: Loud Sessions
description: A live music showcase presented by Nightshift Entertainment, featuring up-and-coming artists. Discover your new favorite band at this intimate Park Slope venue.

name: Sumac + Moor Mother
description: Prepare for an intense night of experimental metal and noise from two powerful forces. Post-metal titans SUMAC team up with poet and sound artist Moor Mother for a collaborative performance.

name: Kevin Holliday, Sebastian Ade, CHOO CHOO
description: Immerse yourself in a lineup of soulful and funky artists. This show features the vibrant sounds of Kevin Holliday, Sebastian Ade, and CHOO CHOO.

name: Chris Stapleton's All-American Road Show
description: The country superstar brings his acclaimed tour to the world's most famous arena. Experience a powerful night of country, rock, and blues from the multi-Grammy award winner.

name: Say Anything: Is a Real Boy
description: The influential emo band performs their classic album '...Is a Real Boy' in its entirety. Join them for a night of nostalgic anthems and high-energy rock.

name: Pulse Presents: Great Heat
description: Experience a multi-stage cultural and musical festival inspired by the traditional Chinese solar term Dàshǔ. This massive electronic music event features headliners like Slander and Dillon Francis.

name: Can't Feel My Face: 2010s Dance Party
description: Get ready to dance to all your favorite hits from the 2010s at this high-energy party. From pop to indie, it's a nostalgic night for anyone who loves the music of the last decade.

name: The Cafe Wha? House Band
description: Experience the legendary house band at one of Greenwich Village's most historic music venues. The band performs a high-energy set of funk, soul, and rock classics that will have you dancing all night.

name: Lyfe Jennings - The Adventures of Lyfe
description: Catch the second show of the evening with Platinum-selling R&B singer-songwriter Lyfe Jennings. This late performance offers another chance to hear his powerful and emotional ballads live.

name: Emo Night Karaoke
address: 217 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002
description: Sing your heart out to your favorite emo and pop-punk anthems with a live backing band. Choose from a list of hits and take the stage to be the lead singer.

name: House Of No: Pleasurekraft Heimlich Knüller ++
description: Immerse yourself in a night of techno and house music at one of Brooklyn's most vibrant nightclubs. This edition of "House of No" features sets from Pleasurekraft, Heimlich Knüller, and more.

name: Pianos: Free Entry before 11PM w/ RSVP
description: Hit the dance floor at this Lower East Side staple for their weekend party. Get there early for free entry and enjoy a night of DJs and dancing across two floors.

name: Ladysmith Black Mambazo
description: Don't miss the late show with the legendary South African male choral group. For over 60 years, they have shared their message of peace and incredible vocal harmonies with the world.

name: Jawani 4eva: Jakari Wing, Jungli, Juvek & Harki, Kalzi, Rajuju + more
description: Experience a multi-artist club night celebrating the diverse and energetic sounds of South Asia. The lineup features Jakari Wing, Jungli, Juvek & Harki, Kalzi, Rajuju, and many more across two rooms.

name: P91 + LPR Present Y2K 25th Anniversary Party
description: Travel back in time at this dance party celebrating the music and culture of the year 2000. Get ready for a night of pop, hip hop, and R&B hits from the turn of the millennium.

name: Bjarki + Julia Govor / Kode9 + Doula / Kamran Sadeghi
description: Dive into a multi-room club night featuring a lineup of cutting-edge electronic artists. The event includes sets from Iceland's Bjarki, techno artist Julia Govor, and Hyperdub label head Kode9.

name: Favela Fridays: Baile Funk DJs & Live Percussion
description: Experience the vibrant sounds and energy of Brazil with a night dedicated to Baile Funk. The party features top DJs and the infectious rhythms of live percussion.

name: Afrobeat Nights NYC
description: Dance the night away to the vibrant and infectious sounds of Afrobeat music. This late-night party features top DJs spinning the best tracks from across the continent.

name: High Line Tour: From Freight to Flowers
address: Gansevoort St to 34th St, New York, NY
description: Hear the story behind New York City's park in the sky from knowledgeable High Line docents. This walking tour covers the history of the elevated railway and its transformation into a world-renowned public space.

name: Summer Family Discovery Weekends
description: Explore nature together as a family at these weekend events in the garden. Hands-on stations located throughout the meadow, woodland, and marsh habitats encourage discovery and learning.

name: Garden Sketchbook
description: Learn how to make a beautiful accordion sketchbook and fill it with nature drawings and notes. This creative workshop takes place in the scenic surroundings of the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

name: CityParks PuppetMobile: Pippi Longstocking
description: Enjoy a free marionette theater performance celebrating the 80th anniversary of the beloved children's story, "Pippi Longstocking". The CityParks PuppetMobile brings this classic tale to life for audiences of all ages in parks across the city.

name: Free Açaí Bowls at Sambazon’s Grand Opening
description: Celebrate the grand opening of Sambazon's new Bed-Stuy location with a delicious treat. Be one of the first 200 people in line to receive a free and refreshing açaí bowl.

name: Open Hours at the Old Stone House
description: Come visit the Old Stone House, a historic Dutch farmhouse and the site of the 1776 Battle of Brooklyn. Explore the reconstructed house and learn about its pivotal role in American history.

name: African Popup Festival 2025 - Summer Edition
description: Immerse yourself in a vibrant celebration of African culture, food, music, and art. This free outdoor festival in the heart of Brooklyn's Flatbush neighborhood shines a spotlight on the richness of African heritage.

name: STOOP SET Presents "OPEN STREETS" on Franklin Avenue
description: Join the community for a summer block party and gathering on Franklin Avenue. This "Open Streets" event brings people together for a day of music, food, and local fun.

name: Brooklyn Pop-Up x Red Hook Summer Market
description: Discover one-of-a-kind treasures from local artists, designers, and makers at this summer market. Enjoy delicious food, a live DJ, and family-friendly fun in the vibrant Red Hook neighborhood.

name: Carefreeblackgirl Festival
description: Join an interactive day festival that celebrates Black women with music, food, and community. This annual event features Black women DJs, performers, a vendor market, and creative activations.

name: Discover Green-Wood Trolley Tour
description: Hop on board a comfortable trolley for an expert-led tour of Green-Wood's historic landscape. Discover the cemetery's 478 acres of art, history, and nature, and visit the graves of some of its most fascinating permanent residents.

name: Brooklyn Summer Beer Wine & Spirits Fest
description: Enjoy unlimited samples of over 100 styles of craft beer, wine, and spirits from around the world. This tasting event at the Brooklyn Navy Yard also features live entertainment, food vendors, and interactive games.

name: Public Super Tour of NYC: Heroes, Comics and More!
description: Explore New York City's rich connections to superheroes and comic book history on this exciting walking tour. Visit famous filming locations and discover the real-life places that inspired classic stories.

name: Free Show Brain Concert
address: Knickerbocker Ave & Starr St, Brooklyn, NY 11237
description: Catch a free outdoor concert in the park featuring a lineup of exciting bands. This show includes performances by A Place to Bury Strangers, Pop Music Fever Dream, Venus Twins, Pons, and Dog Date.

name: The Nursery: Bêvèrãgęš w/ Lloyd + Planet B + Fernelly
description: Enjoy a sophisticated afternoon of music and wine tasting in the garden at Public Records. This edition of The Nursery features DJ sets from Lloyd, Planet B, and Fernelly.

name: BRIC Celebrate Brooklyn! at Brower Park
address: Brooklyn Ave & Prospect Pl, Brooklyn, NY 11213
description: Experience a special pop-up edition of the BRIC Celebrate Brooklyn! festival in Crown Heights. The free event features reggae legend Johnny Osbourne, hip-hop pioneers Smif-N-Wessun, and a screening of "Bam Bam: The Sister Nancy Story."

name: Chet Faker (DJ Set), Ivan Berko, Alejandra Sabillón
description: Catch an amazing rooftop DJ set from the acclaimed Australian artist Chet Faker. With support from Ivan Berko and Alejandra Sabillón, it's the perfect soundtrack for a summer evening with city views.

name: Record Fair at Daddy’s Bar
description: Vinyl enthusiasts can browse through crates of records at this pop-up fair in Williamsburg. Find hidden gems and classic albums from a variety of local vendors.

name: NEMS Presents: GORILLAFEST
description: The unofficial mayor of Coney Island, Nems, returns with an all-star lineup of hip-hop legends. Gorillafest features iconic acts such as Busta Rhymes, ONYX, and M.O.P. for a hard-hitting day of music by the beach.

name: S2O New York (Two Day Pass)
description: Experience the world's wettest festival, direct from Thailand, for a two-day electronic music event. Get ready for a massive production featuring water effects, world-class DJs, and an immersive atmosphere.

name: Sun To The Moon: Summer Boat Party Series
description: Take to the water for a summer boat party cruise with incredible views of the city skyline. Enjoy live DJs spinning tunes as you sail from sunset into the night.

name: Scream Scene Presents: Child’s Play
description: Catch a free screening of the classic 1988 horror film "Child’s Play" at this Bushwick rock bar. It's the perfect opportunity for horror fans to revisit the iconic killer doll's origin story.

name: Ocean Alley - North America 2025 Tour
description: The Australian psychedelic surf-rock band brings their acclaimed live show to Brooklyn. Don't miss their unique blend of atmospheric rock and reggae rhythms at a historic, newly restored venue.

name: 81355 + Gap Girls
description: Experience a live performance from the experimental hip-hop group 81355, with support from Gap Girls. This show takes place in The Bar at Public Records, a space designed for intimate performances.

name: late night drive home
description: Catch a live performance by the rising indie rock band "late night drive home". Their dreamy and introspective sound has been captivating audiences across the country.

name: Lyrah, Fi Sullivan
description: Discover two rising artists in the intimate Zone One space at Elsewhere. This double bill features the captivating music of Lyrah and Fi Sullivan.

name: Green-Wood After Hours
description: Experience Green-Wood Cemetery after the gates have closed to the public. This special tour allows you to explore the grounds in a magical ambiance and includes rare access to the historic Catacombs.

name: Candle Room: S2 Episode 4
description: Enjoy an intimate evening of performances and interviews with talented singer-songwriters. This edition of the Candle Room series features Hope Woodard, Katie Martucci, and Taylor Ashton.

name: DRUNK BOLLYWOOD LIVE!
description: Experience a live comedy and performance event celebrating the vibrant world of Bollywood. Get ready for a night of high-energy entertainment, music, and laughter.

name: Tarka Mela
description: Join a vibrant party featuring a diverse lineup of artists blending global sounds. The night includes performances from Innov Gnawa, Lapgan, UPROOT ANDY, DJ Raqx, and more.

name: Friday Beers X Union Hall Red Cup Rager Keg Party
description: Get ready for a classic keg party hosted by the crew from the popular "Friday Beers" media brand. Expect a night of fun, music, and plenty of beer at this Park Slope venue.

name: Pianos: Free Entry before 11PM w/ RSVP
description: Hit the dance floor at this Lower East Side staple for their weekend party. Get there early for free entry and enjoy a night of DJs and dancing across two floors.

name: Elsewhere Presents: Taylah Elaine @ 99 Scott
description: The popular music venue Elsewhere presents a special DJ set with London's Taylah Elaine. The event takes place at 99 Scott, a nearby industrial event space in Bushwick.

name: RINSE + REPEAT w/ Stonie Blue, Ben Hixon, Anything Goes: Tone Troy + more
description: Experience a multi-room club night with a diverse lineup of DJs spinning a variety of electronic music. The event features Stonie Blue, Ben Hixon, Tone Troy, and many others.

name: Ladies Night Out at Polygon
description: Enjoy a nightlife event with a special promotion for ladies who RSVP for free entry. Polygon Brooklyn features multiple rooms with different music formats and an outdoor space.

name: Alta Joda Fest NYC - Fiesta Latina
description: Join a high-energy Latin party featuring the best of reggaeton, dembow, and more. This late-night festival brings the heat with top DJs and a lively crowd.

name: Dancehall Forever
description: A party for Dancehall lovers, bringing together the energy, music, and dances behind the movement. Celebrate the culture and rhythms of Jamaica at this late-night event.

name: Mike Nasty Presents: No Filter!
description: Join DJ Mike Nasty for his signature "No Filter!" club night. Expect a genre-blending set of house, hip hop, R&B, and classics at this Greenwich Village venue.

name: The Great Ice Cream Fair
address: Breeze Hill, Prospect Park, Brooklyn, NY
description: Celebrate National Ice Cream Day at this special edition of Smorgasburg dedicated to all things ice cream. Sample unique and delicious frozen treats from a wide variety of local vendors.

name: Rest in Pace: Fort Hamilton
address: Micieli Pl & Fort Hamilton Pkwy, Brooklyn, NY 11219
description: Explore the history connected to the Fort Hamilton Parkway entrance of Green-Wood Cemetery on this walking tour. Discover the stories of the soldiers, sailors, and civilians interred in this section.

name: Summer Family Discovery Weekends
description: Explore nature together as a family at these weekend events in the garden. Hands-on stations located throughout the meadow, woodland, and marsh habitats encourage discovery and learning.

name: Free Scoops at Heaps Ice Cream
description: Celebrate National Ice Cream Day with a free scoop from this Park Slope ice cream shop. The first 100 guests in line will receive a complimentary scoop of their delicious, handcrafted ice cream.

name: JOUVERT MADNESS 2025
description: Get ready for a massive outdoor J'ouvert celebration in Brooklyn. Expect a day of paint, powder, and the exhilarating sounds of soca music.

name: Open Hours at the Old Stone House
description: Come visit the Old Stone House, a historic Dutch farmhouse and the site of the 1776 Battle of Brooklyn. Explore the reconstructed house and learn about its pivotal role in American history.

name: Green-Wood's Greatest Hits
description: Join this walking tour to discover the most famous and fascinating stories of Green-Wood's permanent residents. Visit the graves of notables like Jean-Michel Basquiat, Leonard Bernstein, and Boss Tweed.

name: Union Pool’s Summer Thunder Concert Series
description: Enjoy a free afternoon concert in the backyard of this popular Williamsburg bar. This edition features live sets from Hannah Cohen and Evan Wright, plus a DJ set from Sara Abruna.

name: Pink Lemonade 2025
description: Attend a stylish summer rooftop party where pink and white attire is encouraged. Enjoy a day of music, dancing, and good vibes with a fashionable crowd.

name: Resounding Silents: Live-Scored Surrealist Silent Shorts
description: Experience a unique screening of surrealist short films from the 1920s-40s. The films will be accompanied by an original, live score performed by contemporary musicians.

name: BIAS: Chung, KA WAI, mauve, NARI, OPPASLAYER, @tfti, NODUTDOL
description: Join the BIAS crew for a rooftop club event featuring a packed lineup of DJs. The party will showcase a diverse range of electronic sounds from artists like Chung, KA WAI, mauve, and NARI.

name: Purses at Pianos w/ Jared Goldstein & Liza Treyger
description: Catch a hilarious stand-up comedy show featuring top talent in the intimate upstairs lounge at Pianos. This edition features the sharp wit of hosts Jared Goldstein and Liza Treyger.

name: Femi Kuti & The Positive Force / dead prez / Elida Almeida / Rich Medina / Alhanislam
description: Experience an eclectic bill of legendary and outspoken activist artists connecting both sides of the diaspora. This free concert features Afrobeat royalty Femi Kuti, revolutionary hip-hop duo dead prez, and many more.

name: Tyler The Creator
description: The Grammy-winning artist brings his dynamic and theatrical stage show to the world's most famous arena. Don't miss this chance to see one of modern music's most creative forces perform live.

name: Atmospheric jazz cruise
description: Enjoy a beautiful evening on the water aboard a 1920s-style yacht. Listen to a live jazz band and sip a complimentary drink while taking in stunning views of the city skyline.

name: Stereo Mandrax Presents: Garcia Peoples / V stoked / Ampelos
description: Immerse yourself in a night of psychedelic and garage rock presented by Stereo Mandrax. The lineup features the sprawling jams of Garcia Peoples, along with V stoked and Ampelos.

name: Good God Comedy Show
description: At this stand-up comedy variety show, audience members anonymously share their secrets for the hosts to read aloud. It's a hilarious and often shocking night of comedy and confessions.

name: FourOneOne Presents: Black Chamber Folk Music
description: Experience a unique concert of Black chamber folk music featuring a quartet of incredible artists. The performance includes free jazz pioneer Daniel Carter, Cooper-Moore, William Parker, and Watergh0st.

name: Character Night
description: Discover new, unusual, and funny characters, impressions, and bits created by a lineup of imaginative performers. This show is a hilarious showcase of the best new characters from the Magnet Theater community.

name: Mal Blum
description: Enjoy a performance by the acclaimed singer-songwriter Mal Blum, known for their witty and poignant indie rock songs. Catch an intimate set from this celebrated artist in a great Brooklyn venue.

name: Disasterpiece Movie Night: Andy the Talking Hedgehog
description: Join a watch party for hilariously bad movies, complete with drinking games, trivia, and free pizza. This edition features the bizarre 2018 film "Andy the Talking Hedgehog."

name: Maria Bilbao: The Evolution of Mimi
description: Experience a live musical performance from Venezuelan artist Maria Bilbao. Her show, "The Evolution of Mimi," blends jazz with Latin and Venezuelan folk influences.

name: You Are Not Alone: An Uplifting Show About Depression
description: Improvisers and artists who battle depression create scenes inspired by their personal experiences. This show demonstrates how laughter can be the best medicine, creating a space for community and understanding.

name: Pianos Presents: Mamicana, Jomero b2b Taina Enikeyi, Kasey Cortez
description: Catch a late-night DJ showcase at this Lower East Side hotspot. The lineup features sets from Mamicana, a back-to-back set from Jomero and Taina Enikeyi, and Kasey Cortez.

name: Alexander Technique/A Critical Practice Workshop
description: Join a week-long dance and movement workshop with instructor Shelley Senter. This intensive explores the Alexander Technique as a tool for critical practice and embodied awareness.

name: Meeting the Movement Workshop
description: This week-long dance workshop is led by choreographer Jordan Demetrius Lloyd. Participants will engage in physical research, improvisation, and collaborative creation.

name: S L O W N E S S: dancing with gravity, buoyancy and viscosity Workshop
description: Explore the concept of "slowness" in this week-long dance and movement workshop with mayfield brooks. The class focuses on dancing with gravity, buoyancy, and viscosity as relational forces.

name: NYC Summer Broadway Intensive 2025
description: This week-long intensive is for aspiring performers looking to hone their skills. The program includes workshops and classes taught by Broadway professionals, agents, and casting directors.

name: Mt. Ararat's 2025 Job Fair
description: Connect with potential employers at this community job fair hosted by local representatives. This event provides a great opportunity for job seekers to learn about local opportunities and network.

name: Board Game Cafe
description: Enjoy an afternoon of board games for all ages at the library. It's a great chance to play classic games, discover new ones, and meet fellow game enthusiasts.

name: Teen Karaoke
description: Teens can take the spotlight and sing their favorite songs at this fun karaoke session. It's a supportive and energetic environment to show off your vocal talents.

name: Fit & Lit
address: Gansevoort St to 34th St, New York, NY
description: Join an ultimate dance cardio class where high-energy movement meets heart-pumping music. This workout on the High Line is a fun and unique way to get fit outdoors.

name: Knotted, Ondine, Tricky, Ashley Koett
description: Catch a lineup of diverse musical acts at one of the East Village's iconic venues. This show features performances by Knotted, Ondine, Tricky, and Ashley Koett.

name: And Scene
address: 21 A Clinton St, New York, NY 10002
description: In this unique show, professional actors who know their lines share the stage with improvisers who have to make everything up on the spot. It's a hilarious mashup of scripted acting and spontaneous comedy.

name: Dirty Little Secrets Improv Show
description: Watch as improv performers create hilarious scenes inspired by audience members' anonymously-submitted confessions. Expect a night of surprising revelations and spontaneous comedy.

name: The Moth StorySLAM
description: This open-mic storytelling competition is open to anyone with a five-minute story to share on the night’s theme. Come to tell a story, or just to listen to the wide range of true tales from your fellow New Yorkers.

name: Upper Best Side Comedy
description: See top comedians from Comedy Central, late-night TV, and major comedy clubs at this popular Upper West Side show. It's a great chance to see established and rising stars in a relaxed bar setting.

name: Diana Wynne Jones Adult Book Discussion
description: Join a virtual book club meeting to discuss the works of the beloved fantasy author Diana Wynne Jones. This is a great opportunity for adult fans to connect and delve into her imaginative worlds.

name: Free Outdoor Movie: Ghost World
description: Enjoy an outdoor screening of Terry Zwigoff's cult classic film "Ghost World". This free movie night is a perfect way to spend a summer evening in the park.

name: Paerdegat Community Seed Library
description: Visit the library to browse and borrow seeds for your home garden. The community seed library is a great resource for gardeners of all skill levels.

name: High Line Tour: From Freight to Flowers
address: Gansevoort St to 34th St, New York, NY
description: Hear the story behind New York City's park in the sky from knowledgeable High Line docents. This evening walking tour covers the history of the elevated railway and its transformation into a world-renowned public space.

name: Emily Witt Discusses Health and Safety
description: Join author Emily Witt for a discussion about her work covering topics of health and safety. This event offers a great opportunity to engage with the author and learn more about her research and writing.

name: Writers Workshop
description: This workshop is for aspiring and established writers to share their work and receive feedback in a supportive environment. It's a great opportunity to connect with other writers and grow your craft.

name: Taylor Mac: In Concert
description: Catch a free outdoor concert by the acclaimed theater artist, playwright, and MacArthur "Genius" Grant recipient, Taylor Mac. The performance will take place against the beautiful backdrop of the Hudson River.

name: Skydaddy, Tyler Cryde
description: See a live music performance from Skydaddy and Tyler Cryde at this legendary East Village venue. It's a great opportunity to discover new music in an intimate setting.

name: Phantom Planet, Range Life
description: The iconic indie rock band Phantom Planet, known for their hit song "California," performs on the rooftop at Elsewhere. Enjoy their classic tunes and new music with support from Range Life.

name: Tuesday I'm In Love - NOWHERE / Kyra & The Chameleons / Still Please
description: Discover your new favorite band at this weekly showcase of up-and-coming indie acts. This edition features live sets from NOWHERE, Kyra & The Chameleons, and Still Please.

name: Blood Incantation
description: Experience a performance by the cosmic death metal band Blood Incantation. The band is known for their atmospheric and technical take on the genre, creating a powerful live show.

name: Plasma: Is Miss Thing On?
description: RuPaul's Drag Race star Plasma brings her theatrical new show to the stage at Joe's Pub. Enjoy an evening of music, comedy, and captivating performance from this talented drag artist.

name: Gianmarco Soresi
description: Enjoy a night of stand-up from the hilarious Gianmarco Soresi. Known for his sharp wit and relatable humor, Soresi brings his latest hour of comedy to this iconic venue.

name: Broadway Barbara
description: The over-the-top and hilarious Broadway diva "Broadway Barbara" performs her acclaimed show. Get ready for a night of show tunes, stories, and comedy from this larger-than-life character.

name: COMPLETELY, GIRL
description: Enjoy a comedy show featuring a lineup of talented female performers. This showcase highlights some of the best and brightest voices in the comedy scene.

name: True Panther x Nina Presents: Kelora, Superfan, cleo walks through glass
description: Discover new music at this showcase of artists from the True Panther record label, presented in collaboration with Nina. The lineup features the unique sounds of Kelora, Superfan, and cleo walks through glass.

name: Stargazing on the High Line
address: Gansevoort St to 34th St, New York, NY
description: Peer at the stars and planets from the heart of the city at this free weekly event. Members of the Amateur Astronomers Association of New York are on hand with high-powered telescopes to guide your cosmic journey.

name: The Tune Up
address: Pier 55 at Hudson River Park, NY 10014
description: Experience a new series by Pulitzer Prize winner Suzan-Lori Parks that blends short plays, music, and high-voltage performance. This unique event is part of the summer season at the city's park on the pier.

name: High Line Tour: From Freight to Flowers
address: Gansevoort St to 34th St, New York, NY
description: Hear the story behind New York City's park in the sky from knowledgeable High Line docents. This morning walking tour covers the history of the elevated railway and its transformation into a world-renowned public space.

name: Summer First Discoveries
description: This program is designed for early learners and their caregivers to explore nature together. Pot up a plant, create a craft, read a story, and use your senses at various activity stations.

name: NYC's “Rat Academy” for Gardeners
description: Learn how to manage rodents in your green space at this special workshop for gardeners. An expert from the NYC Department of Health tailors the famous “Rat Academy” curriculum to urban gardening issues.

name: Summer Screenings, Slumlord Millionaire
description: Attend a screening of the powerful documentary "Slumlord Millionaire," which exposes the David-and-Goliath struggles for housing justice in New York City. The film highlights the fight against tenant harassment by predatory landlords.

name: CA7RIEL & Paco Amoroso
description: The explosive Argentinian trap duo brings their high-energy live show to Brooklyn. Experience the unique and genre-bending sound that has made them international stars.

name: Lord Huron
description: The beloved indie folk band Lord Huron performs under the stars at this classic outdoor venue. Enjoy their cinematic and atmospheric songs on a perfect summer night.

name: The Cave + Derby
description: Catch a live performance from The Cave with an opening set by Derby. This show takes place in The Bar at Public Records, a space designed for intimate musical experiences.

name: Robber Robber, Dari Bay, Crate
description: Don't miss a triple bill of live bands at this iconic East Village venue. The show features performances from Robber Robber, Dari Bay, and Crate.

name: Broadway Barbara Live!
description: The comedic Broadway diva "Broadway Barbara" returns for another performance of her acclaimed show. Get ready for more show tunes, outrageous stories, and hilarious antics.

name: Don't Stop I'm About to Jazz
description: Enjoy a night of comedy and music where the performers blend stand-up with live jazz. It's a unique and entertaining show that brings two great art forms together.

name: WITS END: Wet Hot American Summer Tribute
description: Join a tribute show to the fan-favorite movie "Wet Hot American Summer" with some of the original cast members. The event features AD Miles and Zak Orth, plus special guests, for a night of comedy and nostalgia.

name: Outdoor Cinema @ Parklife Presents: UP
description: Enjoy an outdoor screening of the beloved Pixar film "UP" in the courtyard of this Gowanus bar. Grab some food and drinks and settle in for a heartwarming movie night under the stars.

name: Movie Nights in Prospect Park: Mean Girls
description: Catch a free outdoor screening of the 2024 musical version of "Mean Girls" on the Long Meadow. Join fellow fans for a night of comedy and song under the stars in Brooklyn's backyard.

name: The Incredible Drunkertons
description: Experience a live comedy performance from The Incredible Drunkertons. This late-night show promises a hilarious and unpredictable time at an iconic downtown venue.

name: Bec Lauder and the Noise, Alertski, Wet Chris
description: Catch a late-night lineup of live musical acts at this East Village institution. This show features performances by Bec Lauder and the Noise, Alertski, and Wet Chris.

name: Summer Discovery Days
description: Designed for families with children of all ages, this drop-in program allows you to experiment, learn, and play together in the Discovery Garden. Use your senses to explore nature at a variety of activity stations.

name: Broadway in Bryant Park
address: 42nd Street and 6th Avenue, New York, NY 10018
description: Enjoy a free lunchtime performance featuring Broadway's biggest stars. This week's show includes musical numbers from hit shows like "Hadestown," "Hamilton," and "Mamma Mia!".

name: Medical Debt Clinic
description: Get free, confidential advice and resources for dealing with medical debt from trained financial counselors. This clinic is a valuable community resource for navigating complex medical billing issues.

name: Frankie Negrón / Christian Alicea / Funk Salsa Urban
description: Crotona Park will ring out with the sounds of salsa and more at this free summer concert. The exciting lineup features salsa star Frankie Negrón, rising artist Christian Alicea, and the energetic collective Funk Salsa Urban.

name: Summer Dayes 2025 with The Yussef Dayes Experience / FKJ / Venna / Salin
description: SummerStage alum The Yussef Dayes Experience returns to Central Park with a stellar lineup. The show also features the multi-instrumentalist FKJ, saxophonist Venna, and vocalist Salin for a night of incredible musicianship.

name: St. Lucia (DJ Set)
description: Enjoy a rooftop DJ set from the synth-pop artist St. Lucia. Dance to their uplifting and nostalgic electronic beats while taking in the views from this popular Brooklyn venue.

name: Sips & Scholars: Robbie Howton
description: Enjoy an evening lecture and discussion with drinks at the library. This edition of the Sips & Scholars series features a talk by Robbie Howton.

name: Lionmilk
description: Catch a live music performance from the artist Lionmilk in an intimate setting. Known for blending jazz, electronic, and ambient sounds, this show promises a unique sonic experience.

name: River + Blues Concert Series
address: River Terrace & Warren St, New York, NY 10280
description: Enjoy sunset sounds at this free concert series bringing global and American roots artists to the waterfront. It's a perfect opportunity to relax by the river and discover fantastic live music.

name: Fish Hunt, Tex Patrello, Mariah Houston
description: Catch a lineup of diverse live musical acts at this iconic East Village venue. The show features performances by Fish Hunt, Tex Patrello, and Mariah Houston.

name: Bigger Than Me Comedy Show
description: Enjoy a stand-up comedy showcase featuring a lineup of talented comedians. Discover some of the city's best rising talent at this Lower East Side show.

name: Zohar & Adam
description: Experience a live musical performance from the duo Zohar & Adam. Their unique sound and intimate performance style make for a captivating evening at this renowned venue.

name: Teddy Abrams
description: See a performance by the acclaimed conductor, composer, and musician Teddy Abrams. Known for his innovative approach to classical music, this show is sure to be a dynamic and engaging experience.

name: UpDating
description: Experience a live dating show where contestants go on blind dates in front of a live audience. It's a hilarious, unpredictable, and interactive look at modern dating.

name: Lucrecia Dalt Listening Party + Q+A
description: Join an exclusive listening party and conversation with the Colombian experimental artist Lucrecia Dalt. Be among the first to hear her new work and gain insight into her creative process during the Q&A session.

name: Path of Liberty Night Tour
description: Experience New York by night on this walking tour that explores an immersive art installation. The tour also offers a unique perspective on the city with illuminated skyline views.

name: A. Deeplove
description: Catch a late-night DJ set from A. Deeplove, the solo project of MGMT frontman Andrew VanWyngarden. Expect a journey through eclectic and electronic sounds in the venue's sound room.

name: O. Wake, Two Man Giant Squid, Short Porch
description: Don't miss a late-night triple bill of live bands at this East Village institution. The show features performances from O. Wake, Two Man Giant Squid, and Short Porch.

name: Summer First Discoveries
description: This program is designed for early learners and their caregivers to explore nature together. Pot up a plant, create a craft, read a story, and use your senses at various activity stations.

name: Bonsai Scale Tour
description: Join a unique tour that compares the miniaturized trees in the C.V. Starr Bonsai Museum to their full-size counterparts growing on the Garden grounds. It's a fascinating look at the art of bonsai and the scale of the natural world.

name: Open Hours at the Old Stone House
description: Come visit the Old Stone House, a historic Dutch farmhouse and the site of the 1776 Battle of Brooklyn. Explore the reconstructed house and learn about its pivotal role in American history.

name: Mireya Ramos and the Poor Choices, Morley, Talibah Safiya
address: Lena Horne Bandshell, Prospect Park, Brooklyn, NY 11215
description: Enjoy a free concert at the Prospect Park bandshell featuring a diverse lineup of female artists. The show includes Latin Grammy winner Mireya Ramos, singer-songwriter Morley, and artist Talibah Safiya.

name: ØTTA, Franck
description: Experience a rooftop DJ set featuring the hard techno sounds of ØTTA and Franck. Get ready for a high-energy evening with powerful beats and city views.

name: DOUG E. FRESH & FUNK FLEX HIP-HOP APPRECIATION PARK JAM AND BBQ
description: Join two NYC legends, Doug E. Fresh and Funk Flex, for a hip-hop barbecue in the borough where it all started. This free park jam is a community celebration of hip-hop culture.

name: Green-Wood After Hours
description: Experience Green-Wood Cemetery after the gates have closed to the public. This special tour allows you to explore the grounds in a magical ambiance and includes rare access to the historic Catacombs.

name: Colatura, Dead Tooth, Very Special Episode
description: Don't miss a triple bill of exciting live bands at this iconic East Village venue. The show features performances from Colatura, Dead Tooth, and Very Special Episode.

name: Zach Bryan Tribute: Highway Boys
description: Celebrate the music of country superstar Zach Bryan with a performance by tribute band Highway Boys. Sing along to all your favorite raw and heartfelt anthems.

name: Jordan Klepper: Suffering Fools
description: The Daily Show correspondent Jordan Klepper performs his latest solo show, "Suffering Fools". Get ready for a night of sharp political satire and hilarious commentary.

name: The Woods by San Fermin & BalletCollective
description: Experience an evening of music and dance from the indie rock band San Fermin and the acclaimed BalletCollective. This unique collaboration, titled "The Woods," blends contemporary ballet with live, original music.

name: Delilah Bon: Evil, Hate Filled Female Tour
description: Join the punk/hip-hop artist Delilah Bon for an evening of live music from her "Evil, Hate Filled Female Tour". Experience her brat-punk anthems and powerful stage presence in an intimate setting.

name: Nocturnal Navigators: Green-Wood Bat Walk
description: Join biologist Nic Comparato for an exciting adventure into the secret world of bats. As the sun sets, you'll use detectors to listen for their ultrasonic calls and learn about the species that call the historic landscape home.

name: Music Madness ft. Zeddy Will — Live Concert Experience
description: Experience a live concert featuring the rising artist Zeddy Will. This event promises a night of high-energy music and performance in an industrial Brooklyn setting.

name: Pianos: Free Entry before 11PM w/ RSVP
description: Hit the dance floor at this Lower East Side staple for their weekend party. Get there early for free entry and enjoy a night of DJs and dancing across two floors.

name: A-Trak & Friends w/ Moon Boots, Oliver Dollar, Sky Jetta, Omicasa + more
description: Join legendary DJ and producer A-Trak for a multi-room club night curated by the artist himself. The massive lineup includes Moon Boots, Oliver Dollar, Sky Jetta, Omicasa, and many more.

name: Cash Cobain Hosting Trippin on a Yacht Party
description: Join the Bronx drill artist Cash Cobain as he hosts a late-night yacht party. Enjoy music, dancing, and incredible views of the city skyline from the water.

name: High Line Tour: From Freight to Flowers
address: Gansevoort St to 34th St, New York, NY
description: Hear the story behind New York City's park in the sky from knowledgeable High Line docents. This walking tour covers the history of the elevated railway and its transformation into a world-renowned public space.

name: Words & Wands: Storytime on the High Line with Infirnity
address: The High Line at 23rd St, New York, NY
description: Gather on the High Line's Lawn for a magical morning of storytelling and artmaking with the artist Infirnity. This family-friendly event is a wonderful way to spark creativity and enjoy the outdoors.

name: Summer Family Discovery Weekends
description: Explore nature together as a family at these weekend events in the garden. Hands-on stations located throughout the meadow, woodland, and marsh habitats encourage discovery and learning.

name: Open Hours at the Old Stone House
description: Come visit the Old Stone House, a historic Dutch farmhouse and the site of the 1776 Battle of Brooklyn. Explore the reconstructed house and learn about its pivotal role in American history.

name: Brooklyn Unity Fest
description: Celebrate community and unity at this family-friendly festival in the heart of Flatbush. The event features music, food, and activities for all ages, bringing the neighborhood together for a day of fun.

name: WNYC's Public Song Project Concert
description: Enjoy a concert showcasing original songs created in a public songwriting workshop hosted by WNYC. This event celebrates the creativity of everyday New Yorkers and the power of music to tell our stories.

name: Brooklyn Stories & Art: Presented by Author-Illustrator Javaka Steptoe
description: Award-winning author-illustrator Javaka Steptoe brings his story of a young Jean-Michel Basquiat to life. This interactive program for families celebrates a Brooklyn-born artist and encourages creativity in all ages.

name: Discover Green-Wood Trolley Tour
description: Hop on board a comfortable trolley for an expert-led tour of Green-Wood's historic landscape. Discover the cemetery's 478 acres of art, history, and nature, and visit the graves of some of its most intriguing permanent residents.

name: Out & Abt: ZOOBIANA, HIGHGNX, JOOPITER, DAALÍ
description: Join a rooftop club event with a focus on vibrant global sounds. The party features an exciting lineup of DJs including ZOOBIANA, HIGHGNX, JOOPITER, and DAALÍ.

name: Beach Rooftop Arab Party
description: Enjoy a rooftop party celebrating Arab music and culture. This event features top DJs spinning a mix of Arabic hits and modern beats, creating a vibrant beach-themed atmosphere.

name: Gogol Bordello, Puzzled Panther, Pons
address: Lena Horne Bandshell, Prospect Park, Brooklyn, NY 11215
description: The legendary gypsy punks Gogol Bordello headline a free show with their famously wild and theatrical performance. The night kicks off with support from local acts Puzzled Panther and Pons.

name: KiDi / Skrewfaze / DJ Chvmeleon
description: Join a celebration of Ghanaian culture and heritage, headlined by rising pop star KiDi. The free show also features Ghanaian artist Skrewfaze and a set by DJ Chvmeleon.

name: Parlour Magic, So Impartial, Gustafer
description: Discover a lineup of live indie and electronic acts in an intimate setting. This show features the unique sounds of Parlour Magic, So Impartial, and Gustafer.

name: Xdinary Heroes (Beautiful Mind) World Tour
description: The K-pop rock band Xdinary Heroes brings their "Beautiful Mind" world tour to Brooklyn. Experience their high-energy performance and powerful blend of rock music and K-pop artistry.

name: Sharpie Smile // Oddy Knocky // Lava Gulls
description: Catch a night of live music featuring three exciting bands at this Gowanus venue. The lineup includes performances from Sharpie Smile, Oddy Knocky, and Lava Gulls.

name: Jordan Klepper: Suffering Fools
description: The Daily Show correspondent Jordan Klepper performs a second night of his latest solo show, "Suffering Fools". Get ready for another evening of sharp political satire and hilarious commentary.

name: Aidan Canfield
description: See a live performance by the rising rock artist Aidan Canfield. He brings his powerful vocals and songwriting to the stage at this iconic New York venue.

name: Bop To The Top Summer Tour (18+)
address: 217 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002
description: Get ready for a nostalgic dance party celebrating the iconic music of the Disney Channel. Sing and dance along to all your favorite hits from the shows and movies you grew up with.

name: Pianos: Free Entry before 11PM w/ RSVP
description: Hit the dance floor at this Lower East Side staple for their weekend party. Get there early for free entry and enjoy a night of DJs and dancing across two floors.

name: Pretty Girl (DJ Set), Slaycey, Sarindipity, House Hats: Lousy Lover + more
description: Experience a multi-room club night featuring a diverse lineup of house and electronic DJs. The event is headlined by a special DJ set from Pretty Girl, with support from Slaycey, Sarindipity, and the House Hats crew.

name: Hot Girl Summer at Polygon
description: Join the "Hot Girl Summer" themed party at this multi-room Brooklyn nightclub. Enjoy a night of hip hop, R&B, and Caribbean music with free entry with an RSVP.

name: THE HUSTLE - 70s DISCO PARTY
description: Get your groove on at this dance party dedicated to the iconic sounds of the 70s disco era. Dance the night away to classics from legendary artists in the heart of the East Village.

name: SLOWJAMSwithA → New York
description: Immerse yourself in a night of R&B and slow jams at this popular party. It's the perfect vibe for a soulful and smooth end to your Saturday night.

name: Summer Family Discovery Weekends
description: Explore nature together as a family at these weekend events in the garden. Hands-on stations located throughout the meadow, woodland, and marsh habitats encourage discovery and learning.

name: Home Cooking New York: Classic French Pastries
description: Learn classic French techniques for making delicious pastries like palmiers and frangipane cakes. This hands-on class will guide you through the recipes and skills needed to bake like a pro.

name: Open Hours at the Old Stone House
description: Come visit the Old Stone House, a historic Dutch farmhouse and the site of the 1776 Battle of Brooklyn. Explore the reconstructed house and learn about its pivotal role in American history.

name: Rooftop Vybz Day Party: Trap vs Caribbean
description: Enjoy a rooftop day party with DJs spinning the best of trap and Caribbean music. It's a battle of the beats at this vibrant event on the Lower East Side.

name: Everyday People
description: The popular day party "Everyday People" returns for another installment of good music and good vibes. Join a diverse and energetic crowd for one of the city's most beloved social events.

name: Birding in Peace
description: Join an early morning walking tour for special access to discover the many birds that call Green-Wood home. This tour offers a peaceful opportunity to connect with nature before the cemetery opens to the public.

name: Taiwanese Waves
description: Enjoy a showcase of Taiwanese music and culture at this free concert in Central Park The lineup features singer-songwriter Enno Cheng, indigenous soul artist ABAO + Nanguaq Girls, and the innovative Bulareyaung Dance Company

name: Stereo Mandrax Presents: LM Connors + Lee Ranaldo / Samara Lubelski & Bill Nace duo / Sam Weinberg trio
description: Experience a night of experimental and avant-garde music on the Lower East Side. The show features a lineup of innovative artists, including a collaboration with Sonic Youth's Lee Ranaldo.

name: MITCH WOOD! MY IMPRESSION OF A SHOW!
description: Enjoy a comedy show with the hilarious Mitch Wood Get ready for a night of laughter and entertainment from this talented performer

name: Lust Orchid, WAAXGIIRL, Blums, Paris Archives
description: Catch a lineup of diverse live musical acts at one of the East Village's iconic venues. This show features performances by Lust Orchid, WAAXGIIRL, Blums, and Paris Archives.

name: The Moth StorySLAM
description: This open-mic storytelling competition is open to anyone with a five-minute story to share on the night’s theme Come to tell a story, or just to listen to the wide range of true tales from your fellow New Yorkers

name: Upper Best Side Comedy
description: See top comedians from Comedy Central, late-night TV, and major comedy clubs at this popular Upper West Side show. It's a great chance to see established and rising stars in a relaxed bar setting.

name: Leonard Library's Reopening
description: Join the community to celebrate the reopening of the Leonard Library branch. This event marks the return of a beloved local resource for learning and community gathering.

name: Wood Hood Hangout: Screen, Snack & Chat
description: Teens are invited to a movie screening and discussion at the library. It's a perfect opportunity to hang out, enjoy some snacks, and chat about the film.

name: Eastern Aphasia Caress (EAC): Artist-Led Sensory Tour
address: Gansevoort St to 34th St, New York, NY
description: Join artist Kaela Mei-Chee Chambers for a guided sensory tour of her Art on the High Line commission. This unique experience invites participants to engage with the artwork through touch, sound, and other senses.

name: High Line Tour: From Freight to Flowers
address: Gansevoort St to 34th St, New York, NY
description: Hear the story behind New York City's park in the sky from knowledgeable High Line docents. This evening walking tour covers the history of the elevated railway and its transformation into a world-renowned public space.

name: Letters from Home: Workshop Series
description: Join a writing workshop series for the community at the Bedford Library. This is a great space to explore your creativity and connect with other local writers.

name: Oysters & the Archive: The Legacy of Black Foodways and Entrepreneurship in Brooklyn
description: Join a talk exploring the history of oyster culture and Black entrepreneurship in Brooklyn. This fascinating discussion delves into the rich legacy of Black foodways in the borough.

name: Minaret Records presents: Zach Phillips + John Roseboro, Dagmar Zuniga (DJ)
description: Enjoy a rooftop showcase of artists from Minaret Records. The evening features live performances by Zach Phillips and John Roseboro, plus a DJ set from Dagmar Zuniga.

name: Tuesday I'm In Love - Hannah Stone / Bugsley / Sammi Lanzetta
description: Discover your new favorite band at this weekly showcase of up-and-coming indie acts. This edition features live sets from Hannah Stone, Bugsley, and Sammi Lanzetta.
